Note: Date based on the date of the Victory Liberty Loan campaign. Orientation: Vertical.
Description: Text tells about Thomas O. Neibour, Private, Co. M, 167th Infantry, who received a citation of honor for his action against the enemy in France. Although wounded early in his patrol he was able to fight alone and conquer. Illustration shows Thomas Neibour fighting off his four attackers.
Digital Collection: Allied Posters of World War I
Local Rights Statement: This material is made available for private study, scholarship, and research use. For access to the original or a high resolution reproduction, contact: Temple University Libraries, Special Collections Research Center, scrc@temple.edu, 215-204-8257.

Title: America's immortals Thomas O. Neibour.
